title: Number of divorces in Sweden 2008 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Number of divorces, with a total of 11 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2017 to 2013.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2013 to 2011.
Similarly, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2010 to 2008.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2018 to 2017.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2011 to 2010.
gold: The number of divorces in Sweden peaked in 2013 , when almost 27 thousand couples got divorced . Since then the divorce number decreased until 2018 , when it again increased and amounted to almost 25 thousand divorces . A similar trend can be seen in the neighbor country Norway , where the number of divorces decreased for several years but increased again in 2017 .
